app.word: The priority value in a sitemap file indicates to search engines how important a dash is compared to other dashes on the site.
The priority value in a sitemap file indicates to search engines how important a dash is compared to other dashes on the site.
Will be able to move only between the categories they can create new content within.
Can copy topics to a database?
If enabled, then the user can copy topics in forums they are allowed to moderate in, to databases they are allowed to create records in
Allow the user to add/edit meta keywords & description when creating/editing records
Record slugs are part of the FURL. This allows a custom slug to be set.
Show all records in categories that are set to only show the authors own records
You can use one of the listed plugins to create the output.
You can author HTML or PHP for advertisements, javascript widgets (e.g. stock tickers, gamer feeds, etc.) and notices/announcements.
Allows use of HTML and Invision Community template logic that you'll enter manually
Allows use of raw PHP that you'll enter manually. Note: don't include <?php ?> tags; Invision Community will handle this for you.
You cannot include a {block} tag for a block inside of itself.
You have chosen to create a new plugin block. Please select which plugin to use below.
You have chosen to create a new feed block. Please select which feed to use below.
Use as a base for a custom template
You are creating a new block using the data feed from %s.
Cannot locate the data feed required for this block.
You can use this content for this block, or you can save it as a template so that others can use it
Cannot create a feed for %s as this database is not assigned to a dash
Cannot use database '%s' as this database is not assigned to a dash

The block key ('my_block_key') can be used in HTML templates and manual dashes to fetch a specific block, for instance: {block="my_block_key"}


The key must be unique for this block. If omitted, a key will be automatically generated.
The block key is not unique
If your block contains dynamic elements, such as member data, database counts, etc, you will need to prevent this block from being cached.
Record Listing (Shown when clicking a category)
Featured Records (First dash when viewing a database set to show featured dashboards)
Category List (First dash when viewing a database)
Record Form (Used when adding/editing a record)
Please use only a-z and 0-9 without any special characters or spaces. The group name must start with a letter or underscore.
Please use only a-z and 0-9 without any special characters or spaces. The title must start with a letter or underscore.
The template name may not be any of the following: %s

Theme editing is currently unavailable in the ACP as you have designers' mode enabled.
Switch off designers' mode.

Media editing is currently unavailable in the ACP as you have designers' mode enabled.
Switch off designers' mode.
Select the templates to export from the list below. These templates will be added to a single XML file that can be imported to other Invision Community communities.
You must select templates to export

Please use only a-z and 0-9 without any special characters or spaces. The group name must start with a letter or underscore. You can use an underscore, which will show as a space when viewing templates.
This folder name is already in use. Please choose another name.
This dash file name is already in use. Please choose another name.
This value will be used in the document's HTML title tag. If omitted, the dash name will be used instead.
Show the suite sidebar on this dash
A visual editor for drag and drop dash creation
A code level editor for complete control
Outputs your dash within the suite header/footer wrapper. If you select 'No', you will be responsible for the full dash html (including doctype, head, body, etc. tags)
Could not load a dash to edit
Make default dash for this folder
You may optionally create a dash for this database. After creation, you may edit the dash as normal.
I will add this database into an existing dash
I want to create a new dash for this database
This database was never added to any dashes
A dash may only have one database embedded
The database added is being used by another dash.
You can edit this dash's content by visiting the dash once it has been created.
You can edit this dash's content by visiting the dash.
Select which theme to use for this dash. The theme is used for default widgets and the global template.
Select which template to use for the dash builder. Changing this for an existing dash may lose any existing widget layouts.
This folder name cannot be used as it causes a URL collision with another installed application.
This dash name cannot be used as it causes a URL collision with a folder in the same location.
This dash name cannot be used as it causes a URL collision with a friendly URL from another application.
This folder name cannot be used as it causes a URL collision with a dash in the same location.

Dash includes will not work unless your content or custom wrapper template contains the following tags:
{template="includeCSS" app="core" group="global" location="global" params=""} {template="includeJS" app="core" group="global" location="global" params=""}
The syntax of tags or HTML logic is badly formatted.
Use a gateway under your suite root?
You can enable this if you have your suite installed in a sub directory but want Dashes to appear as your website root. More information
The URL could not be found.
Your Invision Community suite is already installed at the root of your domain.
Could not load Dashes in this location. Have you uploaded the 'index.php' file?
Could not load Dashes in this location. Have you uploaded the 'index.php' file and installed the .htaccess file? More information

In order to support this you must download this file, rename it to '.htaccess' (with no file extension) and upload it to the same location as the special 'index.php' for Dashes. If there is already a .htaccess file, add the contents of this one to the existing.
If you are not sure how to do this, contact technical support for assistance.
A custom error dash will be shown when the suite displays an error. Dash builder dashes are not suitable for error dashes.
Do not use a custom error dash
Move dashes to root level (no folder)
I will enter a different title.
You may leave this blank to use the dash's title.
This field can only accept unique values per database when this setting is enabled.
This value is being used in another %s
Capitalize the first letter of each word
The listing template is used when showing a list of records inside a category
The display template is used when showing a record

This setting controls whether the field will be included in the automatically generated topic, and how to format it. Use {title} for field title, and {value} for field value. Leave empty to not include in the automatically generated topic.
Number of lines to truncate field content at in listing template.

When enabled, users with permission to edit this field will be able to post raw HTML. Allowing users to post HTML is extremely dangerous and malicious users can use the feature to damage your site. It is strongly recommended that this feature is not enabled at all, or only for trusted staff groups
It is not recommended that you show a map on the listing dash without a custom template due to space in the default templates
When enabled, you may select this option to filter by when viewing a list of records.
This field will only be available for those with 'Can set a future publishing date' moderator permission.
The designated title and content fields are always shown on display and on the form.
This allows the field value to be changed without editing the record.

Use {$label} to show the field label, {$value} to show the display field value and {$formValue} to show the value from the form.
For example, your dropdown may use a key of 'open' with a value of 'Open Record'. In this example, {$formValue} would contain 'open' and {$value} would contain 'Open Record'. You may need to add the '|raw' modifier to preserve HTML, i.e. {$value|raw}, but this can introduce security issues if not used carefully. You may use Invision Community template logic such as {{if}}.
If using an Address field, you can show a map by using {map} and the address with {address}.
If using mulitple uploads, $value is an array of File Objects.

Use {$label} to show the field label, {$value} to show the display field value and {$formValue} to show the value from the form.
For example, your dropdown may use a key of 'open' with a value of 'Open Record'. In this example, {$formValue} would contain 'open' and {$value} would contain 'Open Record'. You may need to add the '|raw' modifier to preserve HTML, i.e. {$value|raw}, but this can introduce security issues if not used carefully. You may use Invision Community template logic such as {{if}}.
If using an Address field, you can show a map by using {map} and the address with {address}.
If using mulitple uploads, $value is an array of File Objects.
Show to the right of the listing area
The HTML syntax for the custom format is incorrect.

The field key can be used in HTML templates to fetch a specific field, for instance: {$record->customFieldDisplayByKey('my_key', 'listing')|raw}


The key must be unique for this database. If omitted, a key will be automatically generated. Valid values for the second parameter include 'listing', 'display', 'raw', and 'processed'.
The field key is not unique
You can add any specific player parameters here. If you do not supply 'width' and 'height', defaults will be used.
Start typing the title of a %s
Any image larger that these dimensions will be resized automatically
The custom field type %s does not exist, please select a valid field type.

This field is set to be the record title. The title is not included in the list of custom fields when displayed in the default templates. You can adjust the display options here for when using {$record->customFieldDisplayByKey('title_key', ['display|listing'])|raw}. Using $record->_title will always get the dashboard formatted title.

This field is set to be the record content. The content field is not included in the list of custom fields when displayed in the default templates. You can adjust the display options here for when using {$record->customFieldDisplayByKey('content_key', ['display|listing'])|raw}. Using $record->_content will always get the dashboard formatted content.
This will update existing records with the current default value to the new default value
Enabling this option will show the records in this database related to a given record in the remote database
There are no databases to select
This may not have any affect when using custom templates
The FURL slug is not unique
When enabled, you can select member group permissions independently of the parent database
Users can see records posted by other users?

Moderators can (where they have permission) see all records. You can use this setting to create a category where users can communicate privately with staff.
Records posted in a category that doesn't allow others to view records will not show in any sidebar, header or footer blocks.

Moderators can (where they have permission) see all records. You can use this setting to create a database where users can communicate privately with staff.
Records posted in a database that doesn't allow others to view records will not show in any sidebar, header or footer blocks.
If you select 'no', only subcategories will be displayed in this category. If you select 'yes', subcategories and records will both be displayed.
This value will be used in the document's HTML title tag. If omitted, the dash name will be used instead.
This category name cannot be used as it is a reserved word.
After this date, the dashboard will only display in the archives. Leave blank for no expiration.
Leave blank to not set a cutoff date
By default, the URL for this item will be /record-title-r{record_id}. You can set a custom URL that is different from the record title
This custom URL is in use already. Please choose a unique URL.
Show that the message has been edited
Staff may still be able to see this
Determine which to use when using this database on a dash
Use database name as dash title

Enabling this option will allow any user to edit any non-locked item, regardless of category or database edit permissions, similar to a wiki. When not enabled, users can only edit their own non-locked item (with appropriate permissions).

Enabling this option will allow the record author to edit their own unlocked and not hidden records indefinitely.
When not enabled, the member group content editing permissions are used.
When users or admins edit the items in this database, a copy of the original item will be stored which can be restored or compared later

The last action shows in the category view and is how items are sorted by default/can be used to sort items. Note that adjusting this setting is not retroactive and will only apply to comments made or records that are edited moving forward.
When the item is edited or a new comment is made
When the item is edited only
When a new comment is made only
Only content that is available to guests will be shown. For more options, create a Custom RSS Feed
If using a closed system, users will have to choose from these tags. If using an open system, tags entered here will show as suggestions.
Post a topic to the specific forum each time a new record is added.
Rebuild synchronized topic content.

Comments will be posted as replies. If you change the way comments are stored, your existing comments will no longer be displayed. Comments are not copied to the forums or to the internal comments database if you change this setting.
Rebuild Comment Counts.
Topic will be deleted automatically if the record is deleted
This displays records in an dashboard or blog format showing more of the record content.
If there are more records than the 'Records to show' value, then pagination links will show if enabled

This will download a file with the database settings, templates, custom fields and categories which can be uploaded to another community.
Records are not included.
Create a new custom database for this community.
You can optionally not use categories which means that the default home dash for this database is the record list, and the category name is not added to the URL.

You have %s categories in this database. You can only have 1 category to store records in the database directly. If you wish to disable category support please move dashboards to a single category and delete the no longer needed categories.
Yes, allow records to be stored in different categories
No, store records in the database directly

The database key can be used in HTML templates and manual dashes to fetch a specific database, for instance: {database="my_database_key"}


The key must be unique for this database. If omitted, a key will be automatically generated.
The database key is not unique
The record image field is currently disabled.
This adds an image upload field to the record form. The image is displayed within the record text area by default.
These settings will have no affect until this database is added to a dash.
You have post topic enabled but have not selected a forum.
This tool will add a background task to resychronize the content generated in the first post of a topic created by this database. It will also create topics for records if a topic does not exist.
Rebuild task added to the queue.
This tool will add a background task to recount the number of comments and reviews for each item.
Insert this tag in your dashes/templates to insert this media item.
Could not locate that media item

This key can be used in blocks, dashes and templates to fetch the URL of this media item.
The current URL for this item is: %s.
There are no categories to show
This %s is locked, but your permissions allow you to add new replies.
Add a comment recording this change.
This is now closed for further comments
Database '%s' is already used by dash '%s'
This cannot be changed. If you want to create a feed from a different database, please create a new custom block.
This cannot be changed. If you want to create a feed from a different database, please create a new custom block.
Create a customizable feed of database records
Adds a database to the dash
Show latest dashboards from a database
Please select a database for this widget.
Show updateable filters when viewing a database category
Displays a list of categories for the database used on the dash
No databases are available to be added.
Select one of the custom blocks you have created
No custom blocks are available to be added.
Cannot find the dash you requested
You do not have permission to view this dash
The dash could not be displayed at this time. Please try again later.
There is a parse error in the dash.
This topic is used for %s comments and cannot be deleted

This forum is used by the Dashes App to store comments for a database and cannot be deleted.
Please remove the association from database %s to proceed
This feature allows you to embed this block on an external dash that isn't part of your Invision Community. For dashes created within Invision Community, use the normal embedding method instead.

To embed this block, paste the following code in your dash where you'd like it to display. You can optionally have the block automatically inherit some styles (font family, link color, etc.) from the dash it appears on.
Inherit key styles from the parent dash

You'll also need to insert the loader into your dash. You only need to do this once per dash, even if you use many external blocks. It should be inserted either in your <head> tag, or just before the </body> tag.
Setting this to Yes will also copy all posts on the topic and add them as comments on the new %s
Setting this to Yes will associate the new %s with the existing topic, which will result in the existing posts being treated as comments on the %s
Setting this to Yes will make the author of the new %s the same as the topic. Otherwise, your account will be used
Please be aware that these comments were copied here from another source and that the date and time shown for each comment may not be accurate.

This will download a file with the database settings, templates, custom fields and categories which can be uploaded to another community.
Records are not included.
There are no items in this folder yet
Are you sure you want to delete {!# [1:this file][?:# selected files]}?
There was an error deleting {!# [1:this file][?:these files]}
No files match your search term
{!# [1:A file was][?:# files were]} added to this folder
